alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 8:47PM CDT until July 28 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, northwest Cook and northern Kane. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen near Streamwood and Elgin. - Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible with these storms. Additional thunderstorms may move into the area from the northwest over the next 1 to 3 hours. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Elgin, Arlington Heights, Schaumburg, Palatine, Des Plaines, Mount Prospect, Hoffman Estates, Buffalo Grove, Bartlett, Streamwood, Hanover Park, Carpentersville, Wheeling, Elk Grove Village, Algonquin, Huntley, Campton Hills, Barrington and Rolling Meadows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
